distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for libraw fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:

- CVE-2018-5800: Fixed heap-based buffer overflow in LibRaw::kodak_ycbcr_load_raw function (bsc#1084691).
- CVE-2018-5801: Fixed NULL pointer dereference in LibRaw::unpack function (bsc#1084690).
- CVE-2018-5802: Fixed out-of-bounds read in kodak_radc_load_raw function (bsc#1084688).
- CVE-2018-5813: Fixed infinite loop in the parse_minolta function (bsc#1103200)
- CVE-2018-5810: Fixed a heap-based buffer overflow in rollei_load_raw (bsc#1103353)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: An off-by-one error within the "LibRaw::kodak_ycbcr_load_raw()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.7 can be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow and subsequently cause a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: An error within the "kodak_radc_load_raw()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) related to the "buf" variable in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.7 can be exploited to cause an out-of-bounds read memory access and subsequently cause a crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
